quiz.title: Unit 6: Monopoly (Quiz 3)
quiz.subtitle: AP Microeconomics — Graph Analysis, Numerical Problems, and Efficiency
quiz.subject: AP Microeconomics
quiz.topic: Monopoly Graphs, Profit Calculation, Price Discrimination, Deadweight Loss

questions.question: On a monopoly graph, economic profit is represented by the area of the rectangle where:
options: P > ATC at the profit-maximizing Q
questions.explanation: Profit = (P – ATC) × Q. This is shown as a rectangle between price and ATC at the quantity where MR = MC.

questions.question: If a monopolist faces demand P = 100 – 2Q and has MC = 20, what is the profit-maximizing price?
Deadweight loss in monopoly exists because:
options: Price is less than marginal cost
Output is less than where P = MC
questions.explanation: DWL arises because the monopoly produces less than the socially optimal output where P = MC.

questions.question: If a monopolist practices perfect price discrimination:
options: Output is lower than under single-price monopoly
questions.explanation: Perfect price discrimination allows the monopolist to capture all consumer surplus and produce where P = MC, eliminating DWL.

questions.question: A monopolist’s marginal revenue curve lies:
questions.explanation: For a downward-sloping demand curve, MR is below demand because lowering price reduces revenue on inframarginal units.

questions.question: If a monopoly’s ATC is $50 at the profit-maximizing output and price is $70, what is the per-unit profit?
A natural monopoly occurs when:
options: One firm owns all natural resources
ATC declines over the entire market demand
The government grants an exclusive license
questions.explanation: A natural monopoly exists when economies of scale are so large that one firm can supply the entire market at a lower cost than multiple firms.

questions.question: For a single-price monopolist, consumer surplus is the area:
questions.explanation: Consumer surplus is the difference between what consumers are willing to pay (demand) and what they actually pay (price).

questions.question: If demand is P = 80 – Q and MC = 2Q, what is the monopoly output?
questions.explanation: MR = 80 – 2Q. Set MR = MC: 80 – 2Q = 2Q → 80 = 4Q → Q = 20? Wait, that’s Q = 20. But check: 80 – 2Q = 2Q → 80 = 4Q → Q=20. Option says 20. That’s correct.

questions.question: A monopolist will shut down in the short run if:
questions.explanation: Like all firms, a monopolist shuts down if price falls below average variable cost, because it cannot cover variable costs.

scoreMessages.90: Masterful at monopoly graph interpretation, calculations, and efficiency analysis.
scoreMessages.70: Strong; review MR derivation, price discrimination, and natural monopoly.
scoreMessages.50: Fair; revisit profit area, shutdown rule, and consumer surplus under monopoly.
scoreMessages.0: Needs review: monopoly graph analysis, profit max math, and welfare concepts.
